data.title: Completion Item Providers are no longer triggered automatically inside "" (quotation marks) in html language mode
data.body:
Hi, I am the author of [HTML Class Suggestions](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=AndersEAndersen.html-class-suggestions). After 1.11 was released I got a report (andersea/HTMLClassSuggestionsVSCode#9) from a Mac user, that the extension was no longer working. After testing this myself I could confirm that it didn't work on either my Windows PC or my Kubuntu laptop either.

After some debugging, it would seem that the trigger behaviour for calling the completion item provider for html has changed in 1.11 compared to previous versions. If you are inside quotation marks (""), meaning that you are editing an html attribute value, then VS Code no longer triggers code completions.

You can trigger the completions manually with ctrl+space, but this is pretty annoying since it did work fine before.

As a programmatic workaround, I have found that if you add an array of specific completion characters as trigger characters (so all of a-z) then the completion provider is called. This is not a good workaround however, because it will override the build-in completions completely, so you no longer get completions for normal html, like div, input and table tags or for attributes.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VS Code 1.11
2. Install HTML Class Suggestions extension.
3. Create a new project folder.
4. Add some css (download bootstrap and unpack it into the project.)
5. Create a html file
6. Type (assuming bootstrap) `<div class="con`

In VS Code 1.10 this triggers the extension to deliver completions from css that starts with "con". (You can downgrade to 1.10 to verify this.) This no longer happens in 1.11.

data.title: Display of exceptionInfo.breakMode is confusing in C#
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insiders / Commit 61753c029226f43c12124a75020b5d8b86c60700
- OS Version: Windows 10
NOTE: This requires a new version of the .NET Core debugger with support for the ExceptionInfo message

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new C# app, like the one at the end of this
2. Open the folder in VS Code
3. Have the C# extension generate a launch.json/tasks.json
4. Debug once to have the exception breakpoint triggers populated
5. Click to enable 'All Exceptions'
6. Debug again

Result:
![exception text](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11078489/24880284/b9e7a3fc-1dee-11e7-8571-163d4d81e383.png)

Expected:
Users will not understand what is meant by 'Always-breaking exception' from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/8fb7fea7c298cadec59b08d66aff50adf81a2b73/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/browser/exceptionWidget.ts#L76

I would suggest either 'Exception thrown: CLR/System.Exception' or 'Exception has occurred: CLR/System.Exception'.

data.title: API editor tests issues with model references
data.body:
After resolving https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17888 via https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/5ecf0cda9a6c487acc1f0c75a3932954ca9211ef#diff-365a6056bf4fb8d4cd8f2cdc02e58a2bR131 we no longer dispose models when editor inputs change. It looks like 2 of our API tests actually only run green because we had this code, specifically:
* [`issue #20867: vscode.window.visibleTextEditors returns closed document 1/2`](/Users/bpasero/Development/Microsoft/monaco/extensions/vscode-api-tests/src/editor.test.ts)
* [`issue #20867: vscode.window.visibleTextEditors returns closed document 2/2`](/Users/bpasero/Development/Microsoft/monaco/extensions/vscode-api-tests/src/editor.test.ts)

My workaround is adding an ugly 800ms [delay](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/5ecf0cda9a6c487acc1f0c75a3932954ca9211ef#diff-365a6056bf4fb8d4cd8f2cdc02e58a2bR131).

When I debugged this, I think it boils down to the fact that:
* we open an editor (`withRandomFileEditor`)
* `FileEditorInput` is now using text model references so the ref count is 1 after the editor opens
* `workbench.action.closeAllEditors` is triggered by the test, closing the editor
* previously we would dispose any opened model as a matter of that, but now we only do it when the last reference is disposed
* it looks like we are holding on to two references though, making the test fail when run without the delay

The extra reference seems to be coming from [`_handleAsResourceInput`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/ben/input-debt/src/vs/workbench/api/node/mainThreadDocuments.ts#L236). The lifecycle of that reference is not clear to me, it seems to be disposed after a certain timeout.

data.title: Feature request: Allow creation of nested folders from 'New Folder' button in Explorer
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.11.1 (1.11.1) d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39
- OS Version: Mac OS X... uh.. OS X... er... macOS 10.12.4 (16E195)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder (File -> Open -> any folder)
2. Click the 'New Folder' button in the mini-toobar in Explorer.
3. Type a nested folder name, such as `src/main/java`

Current Behavior:
An error stating `The name 'src/main/java' is not valid as a file or folder name.  Please choose a different name`.

Requested behavior:
Allow creation of nested folders when creating a new folder.
(Basically, do what `mkdir -p src/main/java` would do)

Motivation:
In the world of Java development, the need to create nested folders happens all over the place.
If you follow Maven and Java standards, even a 'hello world' program will end up in `src/main/java/com/example/helloworld/HelloWorld.java`.  As much as I wish Java development wasn't filled with nested folders, It would be really handy to be able to generate all of those folders at once.  (Java IDEs like IntelliJ IDEA in fact let you do just this).

data.title: Word-backspace-delete treats /_ as non-delimiter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

This is a weird one:

1. Open a panel such as "Go to File"
2. Enter a string: `foo/_foo`
3. Hit Alt-Backspace. 
4. This should delete `_foo`. Instead it deletes the entire string.

There's something going on with the delimiter detection when backspace-deleting. And it only happens in inputs like these; not in the editor.

data.title: Cannot kill node process when Integrated Terminal set to Git Bash
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.6.5|
|tslint|eg2|0.11.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|;


---

Settings:
`"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe"`

After running `npm start` and verifying my service is up and running, normally `ctrl+c` will kill the process. But when running in the integrated shell, this does nothing.

It works as intended in a normal git bash shell.

`ctrl+c` works as intended if executing something such as a npm script.

EDIT:
After repeditely opening a new integrated terminal, typing `npm start`, waiting for the service to start, then hitting `ctrl+c`, the process terminating is intermittent at best. Sometimes it kills and exits appropriately, other times I have to trash the terminal and re-open a new one.

data.title: Link detection for the exception widget and debug console
data.body:
1. Extracted link detection to a separate common class, shared and reused between REPL viewer and exception widget. 
2. Updated link detection to handle multiple links in a provided string.
3. Added link validation to resolve only files which are part of file system.

Partially reused regex of the reverted PR by @felixfbecker, credits to you!

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/24871735/ef9965ea-1e1a-11e7-8c5d-e01d915a4c44.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/24871911/9f107a04-1e1b-11e7-9278-ffe90b694cbe.png)

Fixes #15760, #17085 (and all its ancestors).
Partially implements #21349.

data.title: Run multiple extension hosts to track down crashing extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Given a command line argument, we could run one extension host per extension and with that track down which extension lets the extension host crash.

If the performance hit of this is too high, we could also run just two extension hosts and bisect the set of extensions.

data.title: problem editing keyboard shortcuts in 1.11.1
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.2 (ubuntu trusty based)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. ctrl+k ctrl+s to open the keyboard shortcut editor
2. edit "Toggle Line Comment" by pressing `ctrl+[`

The result is `ctrl+shift+{` combination instead of the selected `ctrl+[`.

I used to set `ctrl+[` key combination to toggle line comments. Version `1.11.1` changed most of my custom bindings. Now I wanted to edit the settings to come back to my layout but I can't in some cases.

data.title: getShellEnvironment might never finish
data.body:
During load of the window we actually stop any loading when we call into [`process.lazyEnv`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/bootstrap/index.js#L194) and if there is any error during this call, we just get an empty window presented (as reported by many users in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23639).

There are multiple problems:
* there is no logging or notification going on when the resolution of the shell environment takes long or fails, making it hard for us to find out about these issues (e.g. the window is just blank and dev tools shows nothing)
* we seem to not resolve any environment on Windows and also not when [`process.env['VSCODE_CLI']`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/code/electron-main/shellEnv.ts#L81) is set so I would expect we can skip this call on the renderer side and save us the inter process communication on startup in those cases
